p: We evaluated 168 patients using bDMARDs and 56 household controls with a mean age of 50.15 years (±13.92) and 48.47 (±16.85), respectively ( p=0.314). Female sex corresponded to 67% of the cases in the group using bDMARDs, which was more frequent than in the controls, with 52% females, but the difference was not statistically significant ( p=0.055). The presence of comorbidities was observed in 80% of the group of patients using bDMARDs and in 57% of the control group ( p=0.001).
